**Portable Snack Bag**: Use a clean handkerchief to create a makeshift snack bag. Simply fold it around your favorite nuts, dried fruits, or candies. It’s an eco-friendly alternative to plastic bags and adds a touch of charm to your snacking experience.

**Fashionable Hair Accessory**: Handkerchiefs can be styled into hair accessories. Tie it around a ponytail, braid it into your hair, or wear it as a headband. This adds a pop of color and personality to your hairstyle while keeping your hair in place.

**Plant Watering Aid**: If you have a potted plant that needs watering, you can use a handkerchief to create a wick system. Dampen one end of the handkerchief and place it in the soil while the other end hangs into a water container. This allows the plant to absorb moisture gradually, especially useful when you’re away.

**DIY Gift Wrap**: Instead of traditional wrapping paper, use a handkerchief to wrap small gifts. This not only looks unique but can also be a part of the gift itself, as the recipient can use the handkerchief afterward. It's an eco-friendly and charming alternative to disposable wrapping.

**Scented Sachet**: Fill a handkerchief with dried herbs, lavender, or potpourri and tie it up. This can be placed in drawers, closets, or even your car to provide a pleasant scent. It’s a simple way to freshen up your space naturally.
